title: Crash after champion select in the loading screen. 7.14 (25.07.2017)

embed.description: Image LOL crash hosted in imgbb.com

body:
Every time i try to get into a game this message appears:
"Unable to connect to the server. Please check your network connection and attempt to reconnect to the game."
I know that many diffrent people have the same issue butfor me it came back over and over again. For me this error message popped up the first time a few months ago and i was able to fix (don't remember 100%, I think it was by port forwarding) . After a while it came back and I fixed it again (this time by flushing my DNS). This time all of the methods I could find failed.

Since I have an SSD I sometimes tried to quickly restart my PC (while the other player were in the loading screen) which sometimes helped and sometimes did nothing. Event after just restarting the game a few times it worked sometimes and sometimes it didn't.

Now I have it again and would like to understand why, so I can ultimately fix it. 

My set up and other Information that might be important: 

Hardware (more than enough):
Gtx 660 
Core i5 3470 3,2 Ghz
2 BenQ screens.
Legitech G105 keyboard + G402 Mouse (found out those can cause issues aswell)
LAN connection (over powerline)
Dlink DSL-3580L router

Software: 
Windows 10 Home
I used Overwolf for a while but it is now uninstalled
Logitech gaming software 

Thanks in advance and if you have the same issue I hope you can find a solution here. {{champion:53}}

replies.body: League is always online, so issues like this can be common.  It looks like your specific issue might be related to an unstable connection that's erratically losing comms to the game server.   This shouldn't be a result of your specs, SSD, or hardware.  I'd focus more on network related troubleshooting, like the port forwarding.  Go over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as well to help rule out some more possibilities!
I found out after restating my router it LoL worked properly again. (still dont know why)
Thank you for the reply but that was one of the first things i tried.
I am having the same problems, and its only on this patch I been having issues
Have you tried goig the the [connection issues page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)? Helped me twice.
